intro: Coilonox semipedale, commonly known as the narrow-footed coilonox, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a glossy surface, while its flowers range in color from pale pink to deep red. Due to habitat loss, Coilonox semipedale is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
